definition: to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: Happened to be at this time the police arrived, also intentionally shield field in the east day let him run.
sentences.chinese: 恰巧这时候警察也到了，向东故意护着田在天让他跑。

sentences.english: He shrank back, tightly with the money in the pocket.
sentences.chinese: 老爹朝后退着，紧紧护着口袋里的钱。

sentences.english: My son Bill disbehaved. I punished him. Aunt Ross defended Bill.
sentences.chinese: 我儿子举止不文雅，我惩罚他，罗斯姑姑护着他。

sentences.english: There is a lock in my heart , defending my secrets , protecting my wishes.
sentences.chinese: 我的心里有一把锁，守着秘密，护着愿望。

sentences.english: Copper Locket asks Grape why she protects his father like this, and she answers, why not?
sentences.chinese: 铜脑问为啥这般护着他爹，葡萄说为啥不？

definition: to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
to follow sb closely (idiom)/to keep close to
safe and sound (idiom)/to come out unscathed (e.g. from an accident or illness)
to expel/to oust/(dialect) to chase after/to try to catch up with
to shout at sb to stop
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
